definitions.text: marked by a tendency to find and call attention to errors and flaws
at or of a point at which a property or phenomenon suffers an abrupt change especially having enough mass to sustain a chain reaction
examples: a critical temperature of water is 100 degrees C--its boiling point at standard atmospheric pressure

definitions.text: characterized by careful evaluation and judgment
examples: a critical analysis of Melville's writings
a critical element of the plan

definitions.text: forming or having the nature of a turning point or crisis
examples: a critical point in the campaign

definitions.text: being in or verging on a state of crisis or emergency
examples: an illness at the critical stage

definitions.text: of or involving or characteristic of critics or criticism
